All patients require informed consent before treatment.

claims.claim_text: Patients under 18 are exempt from consent requirements.

claims.claim_text: Emergency cases do not require consent.

doc0_19918bad059d.text:
# Fixture 1: Software License Terms with Must/May Conflicts

Users must provide attribution when redistributing this software. The attribution notice may be placed in documentation or source code headers. Users must not remove copyright notices under any circumstances.

Redistribution in binary form may omit source code. However, binary distributions must include the original license text. Modified versions may change the license terms. Modified works must retain all original copyright notices.

Commercial use is permitted without restriction. Commercial use must comply with export regulations. Noncommercial users may ignore export compliance requirements.

The software is provided without warranty. The authors must not be held liable for damages. Contributors may disclaim warranties on their contributions. All warranties are disclaimed except those required by law.

This license applies to all versions. Future versions may introduce different terms. Users must comply with the terms of the version they received. Users may choose terms from any version.

Derivative works must use compatible licenses. Derivative works may use any OSI-approved license. GPL-licensed derivatives are prohibited. GPL-licensed derivatives are required for strong copyleft.

doc1_92a84961c392.text:
# Fixture 2: Medical Treatment Protocol with Exceptions

All patients require informed consent before treatment. Patients under 18 are exempt from consent requirements. Emergency cases do not require consent. Life-threatening situations require parental consent except when parents are unavailable.

Blood pressure must be monitored every 4 hours. Stable patients need monitoring every 8 hours only. Critical patients require continuous monitoring unless contraindicated by patient allergies.

Medication dosage is 10mg per day. Elderly patients receive 5mg per day. Patients over 65 take the standard 10mg dose. Renal impairment requires 5mg dosing except in dialysis patients who take 15mg.

Treatment continues for 14 days minimum. Severe cases extend to 21 days. All cases conclude after 14 days unless complications develop. Complications require immediate discontinuation. Complications necessitate extended treatment beyond 21 days.

Side effects must be reported within 24 hours. Non-serious effects may be reported within 7 days. Serious effects require immediate reporting except for expected reactions listed in section 12. All effects must be documented regardless of severity.

doc2_0912b22f6d58.text:
# Fixture 3: SLA with Numeric Contradictions

Response time must not exceed 4 hours during business hours. Critical incidents require response within 2 hours. All incidents receive response within 6 hours maximum. P1 incidents guarantee 1 hour response time. Standard support provides 8 hour response windows.

System uptime shall be at least 99.9% annually. Monthly uptime targets are 99.5%. The service guarantees 99.99% uptime per quarter. Acceptable downtime is no more than 8 hours per year. Planned maintenance allows 12 hours downtime monthly.

Data retention period is 90 days minimum. Archived data persists for 30 days only. Compliance requires 7 year retention. Logs must be kept for at least 365 days. Debug logs are purged after 48 hours. All transaction records require 5 year storage.

Refund requests must be submitted within 30 days of purchase. Premium customers have 60 day refund windows. The refund period expires after 14 days for digital goods. Annual subscriptions allow 90 day refund requests. All refunds require submission within 7 business days.

Minimum order quantity is 100 units. Bulk orders start at 500 units. Enterprise customers may order as few as 50 units. Sample orders require 10 unit minimum. The minimum purchasable quantity is 250 units. Trial orders accept 5 unit minimums.
